quest.name: Out of the Wood
journal: You cannot help but feel something is bothering Y'shtola.
objectives: Wait at the entrance to Slitherbough.
Speak with the manager of suites in the Pendants.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What Master Matoya did was completely and utterly reckless... But if not for her, a great many of the Night's Blessed would not be here.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Considering the Blessed have only just recovered from their encounter with the Eulmorans, Thancred and the others thought we should stay a while longer to be sure they're all right.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: They're such a kind and caring people. I pray they never again have to face such hardship.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: It seems the Blessed were spared the worst of the Eulmorans' assault, for the better part of Ran'jit's forces abandoned Slitherbough in our pursuit.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Had he been but a few steps faster, he may well hath foiled our efforts to slay the Lightwarden.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Though it pains me to leave, it is time I returned with you and the others to the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But before we go, might I speak with you in private? I will await you in my chambers.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming. I thought to keep my suspicions to myself, but after witnessing your victory at Rak'tika Falls, I fear they prove true, and so I must share them with you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: From the first when we met at Fort Gohn, your aether has appeared...tainted. Suffused with an overabundance of light not unlike the sin eaters.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: When you defeated the Lightwarden, I fear the light which poured forth from it was not negated by Hydaelyn's blessing. Rather, it was absorbed into your being.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Urianger also suspects as much, though he is unwilling to share his thoughts on the matter.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: One thing is certain: with every Warden you defeat, the danger to you grows greater. Greater perhaps than we can imagine. If you begin to feel anything strange─anything at all─pray inform me at once.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You should hurry, before the others begin to worry. Once I have sorted my things here I will join you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Pray go on ahead. I would first attend to this unsightly collection of books.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: <sigh> I'd always complained that her cave was such a mess, books and scrolls strewn about like a child's playthings. Gods, I really am turning into her...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We took one last patrol of the perimeter. All things considered, Slitherbough remains relatively unscathed.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thanks to the antidote, all those who were poisoned will make a full recovery.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: And with the night sky returned, their prayers have at last been answered.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Sorry to keep you all waiting. Shall we be off, then?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Art thou certain this is best?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...I'll not deny there is a part of me that wishes I could stay.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: For two years I have lived with the Blessed, learned their culture, even going so far as to adopt Master Matoya's name as my own. I but pray I did honor to it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Now is not the time for doubt or hesitation. Come, we must return to the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hopefully the others will arrive before long.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I know he said he would be watching from the shadows, but doesn't it seem wrong to leave without at least telling Emet-Selch?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twas passing strange to see the Crystarium so seemingly desolate, yet it appears all is well.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: All things considered, it is hardly surprising that Alphinaud and Alisaie have yet to arrive, but where is the Exarch?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: My friends! 'Tis good to see you all again.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud! It has been too long.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I assume your presence here means you've brought word of the Warden hiding in Rak'tika?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Found and slain, you say? I should have known.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Eulmore has but recently dispatched soldiers to all corners of Norvrandt to defend them. I am glad to see their efforts were wasted on the Greatwood.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Speaking of Eulmore, what came of your meeting with Vauthry?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Yes, about that. It proved to be...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: ...Urgh.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Exarch, you mustn't push yourself. Your time away from the tower has clearly taken its toll.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No doubt you all are tired as well, having traveled so far. Why don't we all take a much-needed rest before we discuss our findings?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I thought to propose the very same. After your clash with the Warden, you deserve a chance to recuperate.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It's settled, then. We reconvene after everyone has had time to settle in.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Welcome back, misssir. Returned from a lengthy excursion, I take it.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Well, your room has been made ready, if you'd care to retire?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Retire to your quarters?

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Very good. I pray you sound sleep and pleasant dreams.
